stance_1: I eat meat three to four times a week
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: The interviewee directly states that they enjoy the taste of meat and that meat plays a big role in their eating habits, supporting frequent meat consumption.

stance_1: I eat meat three to four times a week
justification: The interviewee explicitly mentions the filling nature of meat as a major motivation for eating it frequently.

stance_1: I eat meat three to four times a week
justification: The interviewee notes that protein content is a reason they feel full after eating meat, supporting their frequent consumption.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: Both taste and filling quality are cited as main reasons for eating meat, reinforcing each other as motivations.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: While not directly stated, enjoyment and recognition of protein content both contribute to positive attitudes toward meat eating.
The interviewee explicitly links the filling quality of meat to its high protein content.

stance_1: I eat meat three to four times a week
stance_2: My brother has reduced his meat consumption
justification: The interviewee notes that their brother's reduction of meat has not influenced their own continued frequent meat-eating.
